name: GradleAuthenticate
description: Provides credentials for Azure Artifacts feeds and external Gradle/Maven repositories
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: workloadIdentityServiceConnection
inputs.label: 'Azure DevOps' Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is an Entra Workload ID-backed Azure DevOps user Service Connection. If this is set, the input gradleServiceConnections will be ignored.

inputs.name: artifactsFeeds
inputs.label: Feeds
inputs.helpMarkdown: Select one or multiple feeds to authenticate. If workloadIdentityServiceConnection is used, these can be internal or cross-org feed names, otherwise these should just be internal feed names.

inputs.name: gradleServiceConnections
inputs.label: Credentials for repositories outside this organization/collection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Credentials to use for external repositories located in the project's build.gradle.

messages.Warning_FeedEntryAlreadyExists: The settings for the feed or repository '%s' already exists in the gradle.properties file.
messages.Warning_NoEndpointsToAuth: No repositories were selected to authenticate, please check your task configuration.
messages.Warning_TokenNotGenerated: Unable to use a federated token
messages.Info_GradleUserHomeFolderDoesntExist: .gradle folder not found at location %s, creating new folder.
messages.Info_WritingToGradleProperties: Writing new gradle.properties with added authentication.
messages.Info_AddingFederatedFeedAuth: Adding auth information from federated service connection %s for feed %s
messages.Info_SuccessAddingFederatedFeedAuth: Successfully added auth for feed %s with federated credentials.
messages.Error_InvalidServiceConnection: The service connection for %s is invalid.
messages.Error_FailedCleanupGradle: Failed to delete credentials from the gradle.properties file: %s
messages.Error_FailedToGetServiceConnectionAuth: Unable to get federated credentials from service connection: %s.
